message: JSONKit - https://github.com/johnezang/JSONKit - There are other JSON libraries, this one is the best I've found so far.
ASIHTTPRequest - http://allseeing-i.com/ASIHTTPRequest/ - Higher level HTTP library that handles things like cookies, authentication, etc.
I thought it would be a good idea to collect a list of useful third-party code.  I've found a few gems that have really saved me a lot of time.
ShareKit - http://getsharekit.com/ - drop this in and you can add functionality to share content (text, links, images, etc.) through Twitter, Facebook, etc.
Cocos2D - http://www.cocos2d-iphone.org/ - a wrapper over OpenGL that handles sprites, animations, timing, etc.  Great for games.
Three20 - http://three20.info/ - The toolkit behind the Facebook app, lots of time-savers for UIKit-based applications.
Flurry - http://www.flurry.com/ - An analytics package for iOS and other mobile platforms, it also collects crash data if you want it to.

Also, check out the sample code in the Apple Developer Center.  A lot of developers seem to miss this, but there are some really solid examples of how to do some things that I see a lot of people asking about.
Anybody want to add to this list?
Google Data APIs for Objective C - http://code.google.com/p/gdata-objectivec-client/ - Support for lots of Google APIs.
Also see "Other useful resources" - https://convore.com/ios-developers/other-useful-resources/ - for things that aren't code but are helpful anyway.
GTMHTTPFetcher - http://code.google.com/p/gtm-http-fetcher/ - HTTP library from Google
iOS like launcher - https://github.com/rigoneri/myLauncher
Regular expressions framework: http://regexkit.sourceforge.net/RegexKitLite/index.html
CHCSVParser: https://github.com/davedelong/CHCSVParser - Read and write CSVs easily.
Tapku: http://tapku.com/ - A variety of views and categories, such as TKCoverflowView.
MBProgressHUD: https://github.com/myell0w/MBProgressHUD - A simple to use progress indicator overlay.
FTLocationSimulator: https://github.com/myell0w/FTLocationSimulator - Simulates Core Location in the iOS simulator, taken from a route provided in a KML file.
Those last few libraries were all by the same guy, it's worth checking out his other work for similar stuff: https://github.com/myell0w
SoloComponents-iOS: https://github.com/andreyvit/SoloComponents-iOS - A selection of useful components for paging, grid views and images.
MTLogging: https://github.com/myell0w/MTLogging - Flexible logging, lots of useful functionality above and beyond NSLog.
RESTKit: http://restkit.org/ - A framework for interacting with RESTful web services.
ATMHud: https://github.com/atomton/ATMHud - A library for the creation of HUDs / overlays.
ASIHttpRequest http://allseeing-i.com/ASIHTTPRequest/ - a handy networking library
Kal: https://github.com/klazuka/Kal - A reimplementation of the month view in Apple's Calendar app.
Should I be better of to use ASIHTTPRequest or RESTKit?
http://code.google.com/p/iphone-color-picker/ - A free and open source color picker view for iOS.
https://github.com/iosdeveloper/SlideToCancel - "slide to unlock" clone from the iPhone's lockscreen using only public APIs
